bibl.title: Gustave Gunderson v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington, ) County of King, ) ss.
To the Hon. Richard A. Jones, Chief of Justice of Washington Territor, and Judge of the Third Judicial District thereof.
The petition of Gustave Gunderson respectfully shows:

I. That Gustave Gunderson is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by William Cochrane, Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory, at the County Jail, in the said County of King and Territory of Washington.

II. That according to the best of the knowledge and belief of this applicant the cause and pretense of his restraint is that this applicant is accused of being a fugitive from justice from the State of California, charged with the crime of murder.

III. That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal, and that the illegality consists in this, to-wit: that this applicant is imprisoned with out any process of the law, that no complaint of any sort has ever been made against him before any magistrate or other judicial officer, that no warrant has ever been issued for his arrest, that he is held and confined, imprisoned, detained and restrained on the supposition that he is one Pete Olsen, person, to-wit: Gustave Gunderson.

WHEREFORE your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted, directed to the said William Cochane, commanding him to have the body of Gustave Gunderson before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning writ; and that he may be restored to his liberty
Dated on the 27th day of June, 1887.
